h2.em: Words from the Head of School

div.h3: We are in our third week of distance learning, our fourth week out of the building right now. As a community, I am proud of all that has been done, and what is being done. Our teachers are stepping up to the plate to continue education for all of our students, and the students are stepping up to the plate to get their work done and to participate in all of our class meetings.

All of our teachers, therapists, social workers, and behavior therapists are working to make sure we are here to provide some sense of a familiar life to our students. Starting this week, teachers began teaching new material using Zoom or Google Meets. During this time, students will have a chance to complete work independently and then come back to meet with their class. Keeping this familiar routine will be important as they acquire new information. In the case students are not able to be present for the live lesson, a video link will be available. Students will be able to leave a message for their teachers on Google Classroom to be answered at a future time if they are not live. Please do not hesitate to reach out to your child’s teacher with any questions or concerns.

I want to reiterate how important it is that our students are working every day on the work that is assigned to them and following our new schedule. It is also important that they do their very best. As long as they participate in the lessons, they will be marked present for the state. If there is a day that they do not participate, they will be marked absent. The teachers need to know how they are doing so they are better able to evaluate their students on report cards and monitor their progress.

We are also very interested in how you feel distance learning is going for your child, so after a couple of weeks of the new schedule, we will be sending out a survey to ask you for feedback. Please be on the lookout for the survey in the weeks ahead.

Speaking of report cards, we are working on a way to get trimester 2 report cards to you. Once we figure out a way, we will let you know how you will receive it. It will be most likely in the form of an email.

If you have any questions or would like to chat about any issues, concerns or ideas, please feel free to email me. I will reach out to you as soon as I possibly can. My email address is: rczernicki@hopeacademyri.org
I hope everyone is following the guidelines put out by the state to stay safe and healthy. Please remember to wash your hands constantly, wear a mask in public, and keep your distance from others.

img.figcaption: LIBRARIES ARE OPEN FOR CURBSIDE PICKUP!!

div.p: The state has deemed students’ access to books essential in these challenging times so they have allowed us to open curbside libraries at 4 locations in Providence, Washington Park branch, Rochambeau Library (on the East side on Hope St), Knight Memorial (on Elmwood Ave.) and Mount Pleasant (on the corner of Academy Ave and Chalkstone). We will be providing pickup services by appointment only on Tuesdays and Fridays between the hours of 10 am-2 pm. Please call one of the locations to make your requests and you will be given a time slot.
